page.title: 06Farming and Housing
page.content: Most houses and buildings in the area used to belong to individual farmers and their employees,but changes are occuring.A farmer may now own more than one farm (3 farms in Kynnersley are owned by one farmer).Usually the farms are still run as independent units,but unwanted farm houses may be sold or left empty,in some cases farm buildings have been left to become derelict,the centre of Kynnersley now has two nearly derelict farm yards.One farmer lives in a neighbouring village on another of his farms. Modern farming trends using larger machinery(and more arable farming at the expense of stock rearing)mean fewer men are employed on farms. Unwanted farm labourers cottages have been sold to people who wish to live in the country but have to reach their employment by commuting.
